meanings.definition: A condition in which distant objects are seen more clearly than near objects.
meanings.sent1: My uncle has hyperopia, so he can read road signs from far away.
meanings.sent2: Hyperopia makes it easier to see the board in class but harder to read books up close.
meanings.sent3: During hide and seek, my friend's hyperopia helped him spot me hiding behind the tree!
meanings.sent4: Her hyperopia was like having a built-in telescope, seeing things others couldn't.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's hyperopia allowed him to spot danger from a distance and swoop in to save the day.

meanings.sent1: Grandma's hyperopia meant she needed glasses to read her favorite books.
meanings.sent2: Hyperopia can make it challenging to focus on tasks that require close vision.
meanings.sent3: The detective's hyperopia made it hard for him to read the tiny clues left at the crime scene.
meanings.sent4: His hyperopia was like having a crystal ball, seeing events before they even happened.
meanings.sent5: With hyperopia, she could admire the beauty of the stars in the sky but struggle to read a menu in a dimly lit restaurant.
